statement.p: A physician ordered Omnicef (cefdinir) 500 mg. Omnicef (cefdinir) has a concentration of 125 mg per 5 milliliters.
What volume should be administered? mL

solution.p: The unit suggest we can multiply. \displaystyle{500}\ \text{ mg}\cdot\frac{{{5}\ \text{ mL}}}{{{125}\ \text{ mg}}}={20} mL
By dividing we determine how many 125 mg units we need to deliver the total 500 mg.
